issue.title: www.androidpolice.com

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.androidpolice.com/disney-gets-a-price-hike-that-starts-soon/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.androidpolice.com%2Fdisney-gets-a-price-hike-that-starts-soon%2F) ### Comment > Issue was reported over 2 weeks ago here: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/213313 > > Was ignored for over a week until eventually someone bothered to test it, and "couldn't reproduce" it. > > Added a different URL and screenshot (it happens on every URL) and was more specific with filter list and extension settings this time. This is on Chrome, so Manifest v3. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/6r1hn6sh2v40gww8c4sscck8wkkgwkodibsn865lso.png?nc=1)

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.androidpolice.com/disney-gets-a-price-hike-that-starts-soon/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.androidpolice.com%2Fdisney-gets-a-price-hike-that-starts-soon%2F) ### Comment > https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/214117 > > I tried to force update, it would not. I decided to uninstall the extension. When I tried to install it again, I now get an error (see the screenshot). > > Seems like I'm not the only one: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/3317 > > Very unprofessional. Now I'm forced to move to a different ad blocker as yours isn't even compatible with Chrome anymore. Chrome 140.0.7339.208 ### Screenshots

comment.body:
I am the one who created this issue.
English translation of the comment → When opening that URL under the following conditions, a blank ad-like frame is generated. It becomes even more noticeable if you use extensions that enable dark mode.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
On the other hand I still have issue with Vivaldi.
The only thing that helps is clearing yt and google cookies from Vivaldi, but then the issue will start appearing again after some time.

issue.title: direct.lc.chat

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://direct.lc.chat/15663096/1](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdirect.lc.chat%2F15663096%2F1) ### Comment > The live chat window does not appear until AdGuard is disabled, rendering the website entirely useless. This is likely due to > ``https://secure.livechatinc.com/customer/action/open_chat?license_id=15663096&group=1&embedded=1&widget_version=3&unique_groups=0&organization_id=0b0e3a08-3145-44fc-81f7-70f03febe2c3&use_parent_storage=1&x-region=us-south1`` > being considered a "tracker", or simply being blocked in general. > > Whitelisting > ```@@||secure.livechatinc.com^$domain=direct.lc.chat``` > ensures the page loads properly. ``` Username: @RevontuletCXVII ``` ### Screenshots
